member.name: M:AnalysisManagerMSGFPlugin.clsMSGFInputCreator.CreateMSGFInputFileUsingPHRPResultFiles
member.summary: Creates the input file for MSGF Will contain filter passing peptides from the synopsis file, plus all peptides in the first-hits file that are not filter passing in the synopsis file If the synopsis file does not exist, then simply processes the first-hits file

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerMSGFPlugin.clsMSGFInputCreator.ReadAndStorePHRPData(PHRPReader.clsPHRPReader@,System.IO.StreamWriter@,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Read data from a synopsis file or first hits file Write filter-passing synopsis file data to the MSGF input file Write first-hits data to the MSGF input file only if it isn't in mMSGFCachedResults

member.summary: Examines the Sequest, X!Tandem, Inspect, or MSGFDB param file to determine if ETD mode is enabled
member.returns: True if success; false if an error

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerMSGFPlugin.clsMSGFRunner.CheckETDModeEnabledSequest(System.String)
member.summary: Examines the Sequest param file to determine if ETD mode is enabled If it is, then sets mETDMode to True
member.returns: True if success; false if an error

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerMSGFPlugin.clsMSGFRunner.CheckETDModeEnabledXTandem(System.String)
member.summary: Examines the X!Tndem param file to determine if ETD mode is enabled If it is, then sets mETDMode to True
member.param: X!Tandem XML parameter file to read
member.returns: True if success; false if an error

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerMSGFPlugin.clsMSGFRunner.CreateMSGFInputFile(PHRPReader.clsPHRPReader.ePeptideHitResultType,System.Boolean,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Creates the MSGF Input file by reading Sequest, X!Tandem, or Inspect PHRP result file and extracting the relevant information Uses the ModSummary.txt file to determine the dynamic and static mods used

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerMSGFPlugin.clsMSGFRunner.CreateMZXMLFile(System.String)
member.summary: Generate the mzXML
member.returns: True if success; false if an error

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerMSGFPlugin.clsMSGFRunner.PostProcessMSGFCheckPrecursorMassErrorCount(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Compare intPrecursorMassErrorCount to intLinesRead If more than 10% of the results have a precursor mass error, then set blnTooManyPrecursorMassMismatches to True

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerMSGFPlugin.clsMSGFRunner.PostProcessMSGFResults(PHRPReader.clsPHRPReader.ePeptideHitResultType,System.String)
member.summary: Post-process the MSGF output file to create two new MSGF result files, one for the synopsis file and one for the first-hits file Will also look for non-numeric values in the SpecProb column Examples: N/A: unrecognizable annotation N/A: precursor mass != peptide mass (4089.068 vs 4078.069) the new MSGF result files will guarantee that the SpecProb column has a number, but will have an additional column called SpecProbNotes with any notes or warnings The synopsis-based MSGF results will be extended to include any entries skipped when creating the MSGF input file (to aid in linking up files later)
member.returns: True if success; false if one or more errors

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerMSGFPlugin.clsMSGFRunner.PostProcessMSGFResultsWork(PHRPReader.clsPHRPReader.ePeptideHitResultType,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Process the data in strMSGFResultsFilePath to create strMSGFSynopsisResults

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerMSGFPlugin.clsMSGFRunner.RetrievePreGeneratedDataFile(System.String)
member.summary: Looks for file strFileNameToFind in the transfer folder for this job If found, copies the file to the work directory
member.returns: True if success; false if an error
